channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senate to extend Bayanihan Act for 3 months
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: The Senate will extend for another three months the Bayanihan to Heal as One Act, which gave President Duterte special powers to address the coronavirus disease 2019 crisis, including realigning funds and imposing harsher penalties on certain criminal offenses.

item.title: Public alerted on ‘artificial rise’ in COVID cases
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday alerted the public on the possible “artificial rise” of new cases of coronavirus disease 2019 as swab test results of overseas Filipino workers started to come out.

item.title: Vietnam, Philippines strengthen cooperation vs COVID
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Vietnam and the Philippines have vowed to strengthen cooperation in the fight against the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic as well as in the supply of rice.

item.title: Roque sees Metro transitioning to GCQ
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Even as the Inter-Agency Task Force (IATF) on Emerging Infectious Diseases has yet to formally issue a recommendation, presidential spokesman Harry Roque Jr. said there is an inclination to transition to the general community quarantine category for Metro Manila.

item.title: PDEA chief reassigned to Clark Airport
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Aaron Aquino is out as director general of the Philippine Drug Enforcement Agency.

item.title: DOH: 110 vaccines eyed vs COVID
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: There are now 110 candidate vaccines for the coronavirus disease 2019 around the world, which the Department of Health is eyeing to be given primarily to “vulnerable” sectors of the country’s population once the vaccines become available.

item.title: Locsin: Use free apps in contact tracing
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. yesterday urged the Department of Health not to spend public funds on gadgets for contact tracing but instead use phones with free applications.

item.title: Meralco assures customers of refund on ‘excessive’ charges
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: The Manila Electric Co. yesterday assured the House of Representatives that consumers allegedly billed triple the average amount of their monthly consumption could avail themselves of refund if payments are found to be excessive.

item.title: Sotto files economic stimulus bill prioritizing mass testing
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Senate President Vicente Sotto III yesterday filed an economic stimulus bill that focuses on government investments on health, agriculture and micro, small and medium enterprises plus startups

item.title: Palace to parents: Enroll your children
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Parents should enroll their children in schools as formal learning will start on Aug. 24 despite quarantine restrictions being implemented to contain the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic, Malacañang said yesterday.
